definition: to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch

sentences.english: I was about to say “the biggest one” while my brother took one step ahead and said what I wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 我刚想说要最大最红的一个，却被弟弟抢先说了出来。

sentences.english: The US Navy verified the information, and struck first.
sentences.chinese: 美国海军证实了情报，抢先发起了攻击。

sentences.english: Let's anticipate the enemy's move and occupy that city.
sentences.chinese: 我们要制敌先机抢先攻占那个城市。

sentences.english: All previous "devil" can beat step, escape the net of police bs.
sentences.chinese: 历次“魔鬼”都能抢先一步，逃离警方布下的罗网。

sentences.english: What kind of ticket do you wish: first clbum or economy?
sentences.chinese: 您想要哪种票，甲第舱，抢先。还是经济舱？

sentences.english: Scarlett for Duhen, the first Korean married to Melanie's brother Charles.
sentences.chinese: 郝思嘉出于妒恨，抢先嫁给了韩媚兰的弟弟查尔斯。

sentences.english: He beat me to the punch and asked me the very same question first.
sentences.chinese: 他抢先一步问了我同样的问题。

sentences.english: He forestalled me to propose a new question.
sentences.chinese: 他抢先于我提出了新问题。

sentences.english: Using project progress and task assignment information proactively makes more sense.
sentences.chinese: 抢先地使用项目进展和任务分配信息是更有意义的。
他抢先于他的竞争对手。

sentences.english: Snapped up to four happy, however, and spittor was forced to kiss nine younger sister.
sentences.chinese: 四喜气不过，便抢先出手，金蟾却强行去吻九妹。

sentences.english: They have to get their name in front of these people first.
sentences.chinese: 酒店需要抢先将自己的名字显示在这类人眼前。

sentences.english: Sure, front-running has always been a problem.
sentences.chinese: 不错，抢先交易一直是个问题。

sentences.english: ACM-V full-automatic cementing equipment owns international advanced technical level at present.
sentences.chinese: 全自动固井设备已具备当今国际抢先的技能程度。

sentences.english: Chicago Bulls coasted home on a 20-point fat.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥公牛队以20分的抢先比分获胜。

sentences.english: I left the room to forestall involvements.
sentences.chinese: 我抢先离开了这房间以免牵累。

definition: to take the lead/to show initiative
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
the quick-footed climb up first (idiom)/the early bird catches the worm/first come, first served
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
to take advantage/to seize an opportunity/in passing/without taking extra trouble/conveniently
impatient (idiom); in a hurry/itching to get on with it
to be just about to/to have just started to
